item.title: US CDC reports 188,688 deaths from coronavirus
item.description: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said on Tuesday the number of deaths due to the new coronavirus had risen by 175 to 188,688 and reported 6,287,362 cases, an increase of 26,146 cases from its previous count.

item.title: Trump willing to spend own money on presidential campaign
item.description: US President Donald Trump, facing the possibility of a cash crunch, said on Tuesday he would spend his own money to finance his 2020 presidential campaign against Democrat Joe Biden if he had to.

item.title: Laruang perlas sa pulseras, pumasok sa ilong ng bata
item.description: Hindi akalain ng inang si Jarine na sa sandaling pag-alis niya ng bahay ay may mangyayaring hindi maganda sa kaniyang anak na si Princess. Ang bata kasi, naipasok sa kaliwang butas ng kaniyang ilong ang perlas ng pinaglalaruang pulseras.

item.title: Recto reso urges ban on deals with firms violating sovereignty in West Philippine Sea
item.description: Senate President Pro Tempore Ralph Recto has filed a resolution prohibiting the award of government contracts to foreign entities involved in activities that infringe the country's sovereignty over the West Philippine Sea.

item.title: No more 'fist bumps' in Malaysia as coronavirus numbers jump
item.description: Malaysian authorities on Tuesday reminded the public to avoid physical contact, including fist bumps as a form of greeting, as the number of new coronavirus cases in the country climbed to a three-month high.

item.title: Bohol officials probe killing of businessman in Loon town
item.description: Authorities are investigating the killing of a businessman and cyclist in Loon town, Bohol to determine the motive and to identify the suspects.

item.title: Vloggers nabbed for body-in-a-bag prank in Valenzuela
item.description: “ Yung isa po naming kasama, nakasako lang po, kunwari humihingi ng tulong... Titingnan po namin kung sino yung tutulong, gano n,” one of them said. “ Yun nga po, yung dumating, pulis. Prank gone wrong."

item.title: Macho men, ginawang taga-deliver ng sushi sa Japan para lumakas ang benta
item.description: Hindi lang sikmura ang mabubusog sa mga o-order at magpapa-deliver ng sushi sa isang restaurant sa Anjo, Japan. Dahil ang pakulo ng may-ari ng sushi restaurant--mga maskuladong delivery man.

item.title: 223 more cops contract COVID-19, raising PNP total to 4,785
item.description: The Philippine National Police on Tuesday reported 223 new cases of the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) among its personnel, raising the total tally to 4,785.

item.title: US, European COVID-19 vaccine developers pledge to uphold testing rigor
item.description: FRANKFURT - Nine leading U.S. and European vaccine developers pledged on Tuesday to uphold the scientific standards their experimental immunizations will be held against in the global race to contain the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: US House Democrats call for postal chief s suspension, launch probe
item.description: The head of the House Oversight panel on Tuesday urged the immediate suspension of US Postmaster General Louis DeJoy following reports that he illegally reimbursed former employees for political contributions, and announced an investigation.

item.title: Makati City gov t to grant P10k to P100k cash assistance to businesses
item.description: Businesses in Makati can be granted up to P100,000 cash assistance as part of the city government s program to boost the local economy amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: Angat Dam water level falling slowly, PAGASA says
item.description: Though still far from critical, PAGASA on Tuesday said that the water level at the Angat Dam is slowly decreasing.

item.title: Sicilian mafia boss eats guard s finger in jail fight -report
item.description: A Sicilian mafia boss serving a life sentence bit off and swallowed a prison guard's finger during an altercation, an Italian news report said on Tuesday.

item.title: Pangilinan bats for higher agri budget in 2021
item.description: A former presidential adviser on food security and agriculture modernization and a farmer, Pangilinan lamented how the proposed budget for the Department of Agriculture dwindled to P66.38 billion from the original P284.4 billion request of the agency.
